summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The inmate, who shared a cell with Epstein, describes the events leading up to and following the discovery of Epstein's body, including observations about the guards' activities, the condition of the body, and the actions taken by prison staff. The inmate also mentions having additional information about contraband and inappropriate staff behavior.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JEFF' by the interviewee, he is the inmate whose death is being investigated. The document details observations about his activities, cell conditions, and the discovery of his body.

persons.name: Johnny Contreras
persons.context: Described as Epstein's cell mate who 'also saw everything' but would not speak due to being a member of MS-13 and fearing for his family's safety.

persons.name: Stone
persons.context: Referred to as Epstein's cell mate. He was taken to court on the Friday before Epstein's death and did not return that night, leaving Epstein alone in the cell.

connections.description: Described as cell mates who shared a cell at the MCC. Contreras is stated to have witnessed events but would not speak.
Referred to as Epstein's cell mate. Stone was taken to court and did not return the night before Epstein's death.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The inmate witness describes the discovery during breakfast/head count, the guards' response including CPR, and the removal of the body by EMS.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein was taken to legal meetings from approximately 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM. His cell mate Stone was taken to court and did not return that night, leaving Epstein alone.

events.title: FBI Interview of Inmate Witness
events.description: An inmate witness was interviewed by FBI and OIG agents at the MCC regarding the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: An inmate witness stated that guards' last security check on the tier where Epstein was held occurred between 12:30 AM and 1:00 AM, and that the checks were not conducted properly.
The witness observed that when Epstein's body was discovered, the rope was not over his head, he had earphones in place, and he had bruising on his face but no visible marks on his neck.
The witness claimed that Epstein's cell mate, Johnny Contreras, also witnessed events but would not speak due to being an MS-13 member and fearing for his family's safety.
The witness indicated he had other information regarding contraband and inappropriate behavior between staff counselors and inmates at the MCC.
